text: even on day seven chaos still reigns in
port-au-prince Haiti I spoke today to
mark Lacey one of a team of reporters
from the New York Times who was covering
the story and this is what he had to say
mark we're hearing that people are
trying desperately to get out of Haiti
even as as aid is arriving can you tell
us what that scene is like there there's
really two seems that I've seen one is
at the central bus station and
port-au-prince it's packed with people
the buses are overflowing people are
grabbing the very few possessions that
they have that they have access to their
grabbing their children and they're
getting on buses of headings of the
provinces to the countryside where
they're originally from so there's a
mass exodus of people from the capital
also the the main domain at the main
airport in port-au-prince there are
hundreds of American Haitian Americans
who are trying to get out as well and
they're being loaded aboard military
cargo planes and flown to South
Florida's and military bases and the
scene at the US Embassy there are people
waving their passports trying to get get
on the list to get out same team at the
airport so there's a mass exodus at the
airport and at the bus station mark is
there any sense that for those who
remain that aid is getting into the city
I know obviously if it a problem for
since the beginning is it improving at
all I don't have the exact numbers for
you but the United Nations is reporting
more and more people being fed each day
at one point it was a hundred thousand
that were believed to be fed in one day
as the relief operation gets more
organized here as the supplies come in
more and more people are getting aid
however the need is so great that it
appears like a drop in the bucket and if
you haven't been fed if you're in one of
the areas of the city that haven't
gotten anything you're desperate
is is is very high and so so it's a it's
a question of aid coming in but perhaps
not coming in fast enough and it's a
question also of the aid that's needed
is so extensive and the infrastructure
and the logistics the organization are
not as they should be
